title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side", ca. 1984
medium: Black and red marking pens (?), brush turquoise watercolor/ink (?) on heavy white tracing paper. Reverse side, pen and brush and black ink, turquoise and red watercolor on heavy white tracing paper.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower center right:  "Voodoo for Peace,"/Reverse side; lower center left:  4.2 [encircled]
description: Four panel screen, comprised of four figures on wheels. See 1997-19-118 for front side that matches this design.  Upper half of figures is black with cutout areas remaining white; lower half, like the front side, is red with black dots.  Reading from left to right:  figure with large circular head and red arrow on top; figure with crown; figure with headdress of two red cans; figure with elliptical head.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side", ca. 1984.
ca. 1984. Black and red marking pens (?), brush turquoise watercolor/ink (?) on heavy white tracing paper. Reverse side, pen and brush and black ink, turquoise and red watercolor on heavy white tracing paper.. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-119.
